issue.title: Should is_empty use error_code in its specification?

discussion.p: The descriptions of most functions are explicit about the use of the ec argument, either saying something like "foo(p) or foo(p, ec), respectively" or using the ec argument like foo(p[, ec]), but is_empty does not.
[fs.op.is_empty]/2 refers to ec unconditionally, but more importantly [fs.op.is_empty]/3 doesn't pass ec to the directory_iterator constructor or the file_size function.

resolution.pre: bool is_empty(const path& p); bool is_empty(const path& p, error_code& ec) noexcept;

ul.li:
Determine file_status s, as if by
status(p) or status(p, ec), respectively.

li.ins: For the signature with argument ec, return false if an error occurred.
Create directory_iterator itr, as if by directory_iterator(p) or directory_iterator(p, ec), respectively.
For the signature with argument ec, return false if an error occurred.

ul.li: Determine uintmax_t sz, as if by file_size(p) or file_size(p, ec), respectively .

li.ins: For the signature with argument ec, return false if an error occurred.

p.ins: Remarks: The temporary objects described in Effects are for exposition only. Implementations are not required to create them.

p.del: The signature with argument ec returns false if an error occurs.
